intro: Camptosema, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a genus of flowering plants in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is characterized by its small, often hairy leaves and showy, usually white or purple flowers. The plants typically grow in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Camptosema species are often found in rocky or sandy habitats, and some are considered invasive in certain areas. The fruits are generally small berries that can be toxic to humans and animals.
